name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

strengths: 100 damage Fire Spin can one-shot most Pokemon
120 HP is tied for highest in Base Set
Energy Burn allows flexible energy attachment
weaknesses: Water weakness is devastating against Rain Dance decks
Must discard 2 energy per attack - unsustainable
4 energy attack cost is slow to set up
counters: Blastoise - Water type with Rain Dance for fast setup
Energy Removal - Slows Charizard's energy buildup
Gust of Wind - Force out before Charizard is ready

competitiveHistory: Despite being the most iconic and valuable card of the Base Set, Charizard was not considered top-tier competitively due to its high energy cost and Water weakness (Blastoise Rain Dance was very popular). However, it remained a fan favorite and could steal games with its raw power.

rulings.ruling: Energy Burn only converts Energy for the rest of the turn. At the end of the turn, attached Energy returns to its original type.
You must discard 2 Energy cards to use Fire Spin, even if Charizard has more than 4 Energy attached.
Double Colorless Energy counts as 2 Fire Energy when Energy Burn is active.
